skillTree.localised_description: The weight of every single insult, grievance, umbrage and ill-feeling, channelled into a single, crushing swing of the axe.
It's a crazy piece of acrobatics, for sure, but it might just work; if it does, the opponent has no chance.
Having been resurrected to live as a hideous husk, Balkrag will stop at nothing to break free and meet his death in glorious battle once again.
Slayers are constantly looking for the most glorious death in battle against the largest creatures, including dragons.

effects.description:
Bonus vs Large: +10 for Slayers, Slayer Pirates and Giant Slayers units
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The endless courage of the Warrior God, directed to bolster this Dawi’s own reserves.
This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.
All Dwarfs despise the Greenskins, for the urki and grobi are the prime agents in the Times of Woe.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Greenskins

skillTree.localised_description: Dwarfs are resolute - once they commit to charging the foe, they put all their strength behind that initial blow.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.localised_description: Though still a Dawi at heart, Balkrag’s grotesque face unnerves even the most stoic of Dwarfs. The faint of heart flee at the mere sight of him and others are emboldened to bury an axe into his rotting face.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: Balkrag no longer sleeps, nor does he tire; every ounce of energy is dedicated to honing his skills in pursuit of a heroic death.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs and Norsca

related_attributes.bullet_text: Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.

skillTree.localised_description: Balkrag’s willpower proves near-unbreakable even in death, through his defiance of the Liche’s orders, a feat accomplished by few Undead.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

skillTree.localised_description: Balkrag is fully in control of his body and mind; however, the corrupting influence of Koros-dar Nael’s necromancy still lingers in his soul.
Horrified with his new existence, the former Slayer is now committed to ridding the world of the Undead menace.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +6% when fighting against Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Tomb Kings

Leadership: +4 when fighting against Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Tomb Kings
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +2 when fighting against Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Tomb Kings
	(Lord's army)
Weapon strength: +12% when fighting against Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Tomb Kings

Leadership: +6 when fighting against Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Tomb Kings
	(Hero's army)

Melee attack: +4 when fighting against Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Tomb Kings
	(Hero's army)

attributes.bullet_text:
Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +18% when fighting against Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Tomb Kings

Leadership: +8 when fighting against Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Tomb Kings
	(Hero's army)

Melee attack: +6 when fighting against Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Tomb Kings
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Balkrag’s torment continues, eluded by death yet leaving only a wake of death. Like a Daemon Slayer, Balkrag’s might and ferocity make him nigh-unkillable. Some have begun to call Balkrag Grimgorson “Uzkular Dumal Drengi”, the Undead Daemon Slayer.

attributes.bullet_text: Entities in this unit take damage, but cannot die.

effects.description:
Attrition: -50% casualties suffered from Vampiric territory attrition
	(all units in army)

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
Dwarfs are resolute - once they commit to charging the foe, they put all their strength behind that initial blow.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
All Dwarfs despise the Greenskins, for the urki and grobi are the prime agents in the Times of Woe.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +7% when fighting against Greenskins
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Greenskins

skillTree.localised_description: From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
Dwarfs are not fast, yet they will soldier on, always moving despite any hazards encountered.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
The living personification of courage, as the Fearless was many centuries before him.
When you've been fighting for decades, the accumulated scars start to act as a leathery carapace in their own right.
"Right across the Old World I've walked, and the New, as well. There's no corner I've not visited, no horror I've not seen... and killed."

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

skillTree.localised_description: Full of grim determination, when Dwarfs join battle there is no retreat, only victory or death.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Slayers, Giant Slayers, Doomseekers, Slayer Pirates, Hammerers and Ironbreakers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Hero's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Slayers, Giant Slayers, Doomseeker, Slayer Pirates, Hammerers and Ironbreakers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Hero's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Slayers, Giant Slayers, Doomseekers, Slayer Pirates, Hammerers and Ironbreakers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: All Dwarfs worship Grimnir, but only a select few warriors receive his personal recognition.
Spellcasters can oft-sense when magic is close or being drawn from the Winds.

effects.description: Scouting action: Magic item drop chance is increased by an additional 5%
Scouting action: Magic item drop chance is increased by an additional 10%
Scouting action: Magic item drop chance is increased by an additional 15%

skillTree.localised_description: Whether it be training harder, travelling lighter, eating less or sleeping better, there's always a way to draw more from the day.

effects.description: Increase Mobility action: Movement range is increased by an additional 5%
Increase Mobility action: Movement range is increased by an additional 10%
Increase Mobility action: Movement range is increased by an additional 15%

skillTree.localised_description: "If they know I'm coming then more's the better!"

effects.description: Assault Garrison action: Additional 5% casualties inflicted
Assault Garrison action: Additional 15% casualties inflicted
Assault Garrison action: Additional 30% casualties inflicted

skillTree.localised_description: A skilled assassin is a cold-hearted killer and merciless murderer.
Lying in wait, experienced and patient, striking when the foe least expects.

effects.description: Assault Units action: Additional 3% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 8% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 15% casualties inflicted

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any large attacker.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

items.colour_text: Whatever foul necromancy the Liche Koros used to resurrect Balkrag has also infused his twin axes, absorbing the life of any warrior who faces the cold steel of the fell blades.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Balkrag charges headfirst into enemy lines, eagerly seeking a worthy opponent to redeem him once again.

effects.description: When normally killed in action, this Hero will be wounded instead

Recruitment Cost: +20% for all Slayers
	(Hero's army)

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).
